result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Order on motion to seal/redact court record

records.addlTxt:
Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.
Defendant shall hot possess any drug paraphernalia / syringes unless medically required. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume illegal drugs / any prescription drugs, not prescribed.
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall not go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No verbal or physical abuse of anyone.

Prosecuting attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant SCOTT A KOTERAS appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless appeared by video for SCOTT A KOTERAS.
